intro: Paepalanthus subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arrowhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is often found in conservation areas and is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
